* {{ja-l|若榴}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|じゃく|k1=ざく|る|k2=ろ|sort=さくろ'}}
From {{der|ja|ltc|石榴|tr={{IPAchar|/d͡ʑiᴇk̚ lɨu/}}|lit=stone + pomegranate}}.  Compare modern {{etyl|wuu|-}} reading ''zaq lieu'', {{etyl|hak|-}} ''sa̍k-liù''.

The reading is irregular.  This may represent a shift in pronunciation from an older borrowing: compare the expected [[呉音#Japanese|goon]] reading ''jakuru''.  Alternatively, this reading may reflect an ancient sound borrowing, indicating the {{w|Zagros Mountains}} of modern-day {{w|Iran}}, where the {{l|en|pomegranate}} was originally cultivated.<ref name="Shimizu">
{{cite-book
|editor = 清水桂一 (Keiichi Shimizu)
|title = たべもの語源辞典 (''Tabemono Gogen Jiten'',  “Etymological Dictionary of Foods”)
|language = Japanese
|year = 1980
|publisher = 東京堂出版 (''Tōkyō-dō Shuppan'', “Tokyo Hall Publishing”)
|url=http://www.tokyodoshuppan.com/search/?search_keyword=&search_title=%E3%81%9F%E3%81%B9%E3%82%82%E3%81%AE%E8%AA%9E%E6%BA%90%E8%BE%9E%E5%85%B8
|isbn = 4-490-10128-7
}}
</ref>

=====Derived terms=====

* {{ja-r|石%榴%口|ざく%ろ%ぐち}}: a low door used in {{l|en|bathhouse|bathhouses}} during the Edo period
* {{ja-r|石%榴ざか|ざく%ろざか}}: a {{l|en|rooster}}'s {{l|en|crest}} or {{l|en|comb}} that resembles a {{l|en|pomegranate}}
* {{ja-r|石%榴%草|ざく%ろ%そう}}: {{taxlink|Mollugo pentaphylla|species|noshow=1|ver=161102}}
* {{ja-r|石%榴%鼻|ざく%ろ%ばな}}: a {{l|en|red}} {{l|en|swell|swollen}} {{l|en|nose}}, often {{l|en|see|seen}} on {{l|en|alcoholic|alcoholics}}
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|じゃく|る|k2=ろ|sort=しゃくろ'}}
From {{der|ja|ltc|石榴|tr={{IPAchar|/d͡ʑiᴇk̚ lɨu/}}|lit=stone + pomegranate}}. Uses the regular [[呉音#Japanese|goon]] reading of ''jaku'' for the first character, and the irregular ''ro'' reading for the second character instead of the expected [[呉音#Japanese|goon]] reading of ''ru''.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|じゃくろ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|じゃくろ}}

# {{lb|ja|しゃくろ'|obsolete}} {{l|en|pomegranate}}

=====Usage notes=====
This reading appears to be obsolete.

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|せき|りゅう|sort=せきりゅう}}
{{IPAchar|/sekiriu/}} → {{IPAchar|/sekirjuː/}}

From {{der|ja|ltc|石榴|tr={{IPAchar|/d͡ʑiᴇk̚ lɨu/}}|lit=stone + pomegranate}}. Uses the regular [[漢音#Japanese|kanon]] reading of both characters.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|せきりゅう|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|せきりゅう|hhira=せきりう}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=せきりゅう|uncommon}} {{l|en|pomegranate}}

=====Usage notes=====
The ''zakuro'' reading above is the most common reading for this term.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|石%榴%子|せき%りゅう%し}}: {{l|en|garnet}} {{qualifier|gemstone; less common reading than ''zakuro-ishi'' above}}
* {{ja-r|石%榴%皮|せき%りゅう%ひ}}: {{l|en|dried}} {{l|en|pomegranate}}, both {{l|en|seed}}s and {{l|en|skin}}, used as a treatment for {{l|en|tapeworm}}
{{der-bottom}}
